keyword: how many calories in a roll from texas roadhouse
title: How Many Calories in a Texas Roadhouse Roll?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a roll from Texas Roadhouse, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdowns per roll with tweaks and FAQs.
h1: How Many Calories in a Texas Roadhouse Roll?
assumptions: Standard freshly baked yeast dinner roll (~50 g), served warm; honey cinnamon butter served on the side (not included in base values).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by exact recipe, portion size, and preparation at Texas Roadhouse locations. Values are estimates; check with the restaurant for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One Texas Roadhouse roll contains about 150 calories and 4 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with restaurant or packaged info.

tweaks.label: Plain roll, no butter or glaze

faqs.q: How many calories in a Texas Roadhouse roll with butter?
faqs.a: About 200 calories when adding 1 tsp of their honey cinnamon butter.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a roll from Texas Roadhouse?
faqs.a: Approximately 25 g of carbs per roll, mostly from flour.

faqs.q: Does a Texas Roadhouse roll have protein?
faqs.a: Yes, around 4 g of protein per roll from the yeast dough.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in one Texas Roadhouse roll?
faqs.a: Roughly 200 mg, which can increase with added butter or seasonings.
No, they are made with wheat flour; opt for gluten-free alternatives if needed.
